content.title: Atal Shresth Shahar Yojna
content.details: The scheme 'Atal Shresth Shahar Yojna (ASSY)' was launched by the Urban Development Department, Government of Himachal Pradesh on 1st April 2018 to select the best Municipal Council and best Nagar Panchayat. The scheme aims to reward and incentivize the best performing Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) in Himachal Pradesh (Municipal Council/Nagar Panchyat) on the indicators of sanitation/cleanliness, increase utilization, public infrastructure, and official work. The Government has started this scheme to encourage Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) under which the best performing (3) Municipal Councils and three (3) Nagar Panchyats are given cash rewards. The top performing (1) Municipal Corporation, (3) Municipal Councils and (3) Nagar Panchyats will be felicitated with 'Atal Shrestha Shahar Puruskar' on 25th December of every year on the birth anniversary of Late Sh. Atal Bihari Vajpayee (former Prime Minister of India) or any other date as decided by the Government.
benefits: Cash rewards for top performing ULBs
Recognition of best performing Municipal Councils and Nagar Panchayats
Encouragement for improved sanitation and cleanliness
eligibility: All Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) in the State
No bar on participation for ULBs that have won in previous years
documents_required: Report of Fund utilization in respect of funds provided during preceding the last FY
Details of the number of sheets registered beneficiaries under Mukhya Mantri Shahri Ajeevika Guarantee Yojna
Details of increase in ULB's own income (i.e. Property Tax, user charges, rent, and Income from other sources) during the last FY
Details of Audit Paras settled and audited accounts

faqs.question: What is the 'Atal Shresth Shahar Yojna (ASSY)'?
faqs.answer: The Atal Shresth Shahar Yojna is a scheme initiated by the State Government to recognize and reward the top-performing Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) in the state based on various performance indicators.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to participate in ASSY?
faqs.answer: The scheme is applicable to all Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) in the state, and it is mandatory for all ULBs to participate. There is no bar on any ULB, even if it has won the ASSY prize in previous years.

faqs.question: What are the indicators for assessment under ASSY?
faqs.answer: The top-performing ULBs will be assessed based on indicators such as Swachh Survekshan, public service delivery, increase in ULB income, fund utilization, public infrastructure, and audit paras settlement and audited accounts.

faqs.question: How are ULBs ranked in the scheme?
faqs.answer: ULBs will be ranked based on the scores obtained in Swachh Survekshan of the preceding year and the scores obtained in the other five State Parameters.

faqs.question: How is the prize money distributed among the winners?
faqs.answer: The top-performing Municipal Corporation, Municipal Council, and Nagar Panchayat will be awarded cash prizes, with the first, second, and third prizes having specified amounts. In case of a tie, the prize money will be distributed equally among the tied ULBs.

faqs.question: Can ULBs use the award money for any purpose?
faqs.answer: The award money is provided as an un-tied grant and should not form part of the income of the ULBs. It cannot be spent on salaries/wages of ULB employees. However, ULBs may formulate a scheme to reward their employees for outstanding contributions within certain limits.

faqs.question: What is the timeline for the ASSY competition?
faqs.answer: ULBs need to submit their claims by September 30th each year. The screening process occurs by October 20th, followed by field assessment/verification by a Third Party Agency (TPA) by November 20th. Prize distribution takes place on December 25th.

faqs.question: How is the final decision on the winners made?
faqs.answer: The field assessment/verification is conducted by a Third Party Agency (TPA), and based on their report, the Director of Urban Development recommends the names of the winning ULBs to the State Level Apex Committee for final approval. The Apex Committee's decision is final.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for rectification of mistakes in the claims?
faqs.answer: ULBs will be given additional time to rectify any clerical mistakes. The Department may provide this additional time after the field verification stage.
